msg:
# show the TCP/UDP listening sockets and their programs
netstat -tulp

# Show socket connections on a port (specified in the grep portion). In this case, ssh (port 22).  
netstat -an | grep '\:22\ '

# List pid /programs name linked to port 3000, displaying adress in a numerical format.
netstat -lpn |grep :3000
# will output something like that : 
# tcp   0    0 0.0.0.0:3000   0.0.0.0:*   LISTEN      14016/ruby

# show IP-to-interface mapping table (aka kernel routing table)
netstat -nr

# your_comment_here
#Open all open networking listening ports for tcp
netstat -atp tcp | grep -i "listen"
